Ratings and Reviews See All 4.2 out of 5 1.1M Ratings 1.1M Ratings Yūki_612 , 08/23/2020 Great App, Some Suggestions Ok, first I’d like to thank you for making such a great app! I’d also like to say that I love using this app and that it’s one of my favorite messaging apps despite what many people think. It’s got many features and special effects and I like it. I do have a problem that I’d like to address, so I hope you read this review. Ever since some of the recent updates, I haven’t been able to add my new phone number to my account (since I recently changed my old one) nor have I been able to change my profile picture. The reason? Well, that’s because I don’t have a Facebook account since I made my account on my old phone number. It would be cool if I could make a Facebook account for my messenger account since I don’t want to make a new one and lose all my contacts, but that isn’t a feature, at least not yet. Other than that, the app is great, I just hope you get this fixed soon and I hope this review finds you well. Abused Elder , 09/09/2020 Negligence I recently had a new breaker box installed at my home and when the workers were done we called to have the power turned back on. When the man arrived he told my workers that they needed to switch out a box cover. That only took a half an hour at which point it was 6 o’clock. So I called them again to have them turn the power back on and the man on the phone told me we cannot guarantee they will be there anymore today it will have to be tomorrow. I explained that I am an elderly woman and I really needed to have air-conditioning in this kind of weather. So he said well that’s just the way it is. I can guarantee that they’ll be there tomorrow. What kind of company does this? You need to get a new policy because leaving an elderly woman in 90° weather with no electricity is unconscionable!!! I even offered to pay an extra $50 if they would come and turn the power back on. So he told me OK they’ll be there by 11:30 tonight. So I stayed up and guess what; nobody came. I feel as though I should report this to the Better Business Bureau . And I will unless someone offers me an apology. I was going to try to rise above it but it is just eating away at me, the careless, negligent way in which I was treated. And I hope to God that it was not because my electrician and his helper were black. Jacqueline Englert Lady Ash A. , 04/04/2020 New Update is Trash, Useless (iOS) The new update is absolutely disgusting. It makes this app not only visibly unappealing, but the new UI is hard to use, foolhardy, and removes many useful features. I also keep having problems with crashing. The new online/offline status is buggy and gets stuck. Phone calls are buggy too and stopped displaying properly. Messages can no longer be easily copied, deleted or forwarded. The old menu was easier. I preferred the swipe reply feature. Messages are no longer easy to reply to in notifications either. Pictures are not easy to send. I used to like this app because of the little unique things like the old cute reactions, chat colors, and balloons and hearts that you could catch. Now, they are all gone. I used to love using stickers, but the system is all messed up now as your most recent stickers and the packs are harder to find. I do not like the excess spacing between packs either. I am not exaggerating to say that I hate this new update. I have recommended that people do not update if they still have an older version. Many of my friends have agreed with me and say that this new version glitchy, problematic, and ugly. I have stopped using it as much because it is useless now. What did you do to this app? What did you do to this app? trixiecheer , 08/23/2020 Messenger disappears My messenger icon disappeared a while ago and I wasn’t able to access it. I was able to do it through Facebook though. Then I found the icon on my iPhone through Siri app suggestions. Well now I can’t access it at all. Not through Facebook and not through Siri app suggestions, which is the only place that had the icon I could access. When I do click on it it shows for less than a second and disappears. It does it through Facebook, when I click on that messenger icon, and even when I try to get Siri to access it. When I go onto the App Store, it does the same thing. I want to uninstall it to hopefully restart it. I have rebooted my phone and left it off all night hoping that would help, but it didn’t. The icon that shows in Siri app suggestions will not allow me to hold it down so I can delete it like any other app. I think it’s because it’s not the app itself, just showing the icon that allowed me to access thru it, but that was it.I don’t know if this is making any sense or if I’m even explaining it correctly. I would literally have to show somebody what’s going on. All I could say is I cannot access messenger in any way shape or form not even to delete it or anything and I don’t know what to do . Ratings and Reviews See All 3.7 out of 5 53 Ratings 53 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. I LOVE Mozilla as a company, entity of sorts; Firefox is an amazing web browser with great features and protections, Thunderbird is THE best desktop email application (I hope and pray maybe there could be an iOS/Android/Mobile version of Thunderbird); They make great products and services. I feel very let down by this mobile version of lockwise... it should generate passwords for the user also just like how it does in Firefox/Thunderbird... essentially, because it doesn’t generate passwords, this is a separate app you download for auto fill which Firefox for iOS already does and Chrome for iOS the same... Chrome for iOS also generates passwords... Slap that feature on there for us Mozilla!! And possibly allow us to protect lockwise with a form of 2FA like an authenticator or a security key! I have a Yubikey 5 NFC and I love this thing! Anyways... if you guys could add those features into this app it would be perfect, I am a diehard Mozilla fan but this app felt like it wasn’t really thought out... thank you all for all the effort you put into your products and services, I am a huge fan! With its easy to use interactive radar, you can take control and see where the storm is now and where it is tracking. Then, set customized alerts to keep you and your family informed and safe. The old menu was easier. I preferred the swipe reply feature. Messages are no longer easy to reply to in notifications either. Pictures are not easy to send. I used to like this app because of the little unique things like the old cute reactions, chat colors, and balloons and hearts that you could catch. Now, they are all gone. I used to love using stickers, but the system is all messed up now as your most recent stickers and the packs are harder to find. I do not like the excess spacing between packs either. I am not exaggerating to say that I hate this new update. I have recommended that people do not update if they still have an older version. Many of my friends have agreed with me and say that this new version glitchy, problematic, and ugly. I have stopped using it as much because it is useless now. What did you do to this app? trixiecheer , 08/23/2020 Messenger disappears My messenger icon disappeared a while ago and I wasn’t able to access it. I was able to do it through Facebook though. Then I found the icon on my iPhone through Siri app suggestions. Well now I can’t access it at all. Not through Facebook and not through Siri app suggestions, which is the only place that had the icon I could access. When I do click on it it shows for less than a second and disappears. It does it through Facebook, when I click on that messenger icon, and even when I try to get Siri to access it. When I go onto the App Store, it does the same thing. I want to uninstall it to hopefully restart it. I have rebooted my phone and left it off all night hoping that would help, but it didn’t. The icon that shows in Siri app suggestions will not allow me to hold it down so I can delete it like any other app. I think it’s because it’s not the app itself, just showing the icon that allowed me to access thru it, but that was it.I don’t know if this is making any sense or if I’m even explaining it correctly. I would literally have to show somebody what’s going on. All I could say is I cannot access messenger in any way shape or form not even to delete it or anything and I don’t know what to do . Ratings and Reviews See All 3.7 out of 5 59 Ratings 59 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. For example, LastPass structures it like somewhat like this: Password entry: - Entry Name - Website Address - Password - Additional Notes Additionally, they have a versatile password generator and you can add and remove entries from any LastPass application. Also, one cool thing that might draw more users into the Mozilla realm is a password Authenticator for two-factor authentication. I mean, history proves that you have been the authority of privacy and security. It’s worth a shot, I think. And if you can offer solutions like a versatile password manager, authenticator, and whatever other super awesome things you all offer, you will raise even more awareness to services like Mozilla VPN, and take back a considerable amount of market share from browsers that could care less about privacy. Ratings and Reviews See All 3.7 out of 5 60 Ratings 60 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. tr0mbonedude , 10/10/2020 Needs a few more features to be This is a great start and I particularly like how it’s directly integrated into Firefox. I like that this app comes from one of the most trusted companies in terms of privacy. With all this said, I don’t yet think it stands out from other password managers like LastPass or 1Password. For example, LastPass structures it like somewhat like this: Password entry: - Entry Name - Website Address - Password - Additional Notes Additionally, they have a versatile password generator and you can add and remove entries from any LastPass application. So LastPass makes it very quick and easy to manage passwords. If these features can be implemented, I’m switching over! Also, one cool thing that might draw more users into the Mozilla realm is a password Authenticator for two-factor authentication. I mean, history proves that you have been the authority of privacy and security. It’s worth a shot, I think. And if you can offer solutions like a versatile password manager, authenticator, and whatever other super awesome things you all offer, you will raise even more awareness to services like Mozilla VPN, and take back a considerable amount of market share from browsers that could care less about privacy. I’d love to see that. Keep up the great work! Information Seller Mozilla Corporation Size 58.7 MB Category Productivity Compatibility Requires iOS 11.0 or later. Messenger 12+ Text, audio and video calls Facebook, Inc. #2 in Social Networking 4.2 • 1.2M Ratings Free Screenshots iPhone iPad Apple Watch Description Be together whenever, with our free* all-in-one communication app, complete with unlimited text, voice, video calling and group video chat features. NEW! WATCH TOGETHER Watch videos, tv shows, and movies with your friends over Messenger Video Chat and Rooms when you can't be together. Capture every moment and reaction in real-time. NEW! CUSTOM REACTIONS Lost for words? Now you can customize your reactions, with lots more emojis to choose from. NEW! CHAT THEMES Choose from fun themes and colors, like Tie-Dye or Love, to make your chats more personal. Host group video calls with up to 8 people, with high-quality audio, high definition video, and interactive video features like face filters. UNLIMITED FREE TEXT & PHONE CALLS Skip exchanging phone numbers and simply send a message to your Facebook friends, even if they’re across the world. Suggest a meeting spot or tell friends where you are by sharing your location with just a few taps. SEND MONEY SECURELY AND EASILY (within US only) Send and receive money securely and easily with friends and family right in the app by adding your debit card, PayPal account or reloadable prepaid card (single-source cards eligible for sending money only). CHAT WITH BUSINESSES Easily connect with your favorite businesses to make reservations, get customer support, find deals and more. COMPATIBLE ACROSS PLATFORMS Chat with friends across an array of devices, like desktop, Portal, and others. Watch videos together with friends over Messenger video chat. React using any emoji with Custom Reactions. Customize your chats with fun themes and colors, like Tie Dye or Halloween. Ratings and Reviews See All 4.2 out of 5 1.2M Ratings 1.2M Ratings A_M_J_95 , 03/02/2020 Nice update the app is cleaner and faster I can’t believe you finally removed all the trash that was bloating this app ,now finally the app looks like a messaging app which how it should’ve looked since the beginning, unfortunately as cool as the app looks right now I think this change has came in too late ,well for me at least because I don’t recall the last time I actually used messenger to message someone and every person I know has move away to using other apps that provided a better and cleaner experience that what messenger used to offer for the past years ,now I’m not hating here no in fact i hope people get back to using it because it’s just more convenient than other apps especially now that it’s simple and clean but I’m just saying it’s kinda late and I’m afraid people have gotten used to the other apps but we’ll see about that... Lady Ash A. , 04/04/2020 New Update is Trash, Useless (iOS) The new update is absolutely disgusting. It makes this app not only visibly unappealing, but the new UI is hard to use, foolhardy, and removes many useful features. I also keep having problems with crashing. The new online/offline status is buggy and gets stuck. Phone calls are buggy too and stopped displaying properly. Messages can no longer be easily copied, deleted or forwarded. The old menu was easier. I preferred the swipe reply feature. Messages are no longer easy to reply to in notifications either. Pictures are not easy to send. I used to like this app because of the little unique things like the old cute reactions, chat colors, and balloons and hearts that you could catch. Now, they are all gone. I used to love using stickers, but the system is all messed up now as your most recent stickers and the packs are harder to find. I do not like the excess spacing between packs either. I am not exaggerating to say that I hate this new update. I have recommended that people do not update if they still have an older version. Many of my friends have agreed with me and say that this new version glitchy, problematic, and ugly. I have stopped using it as much because it is useless now. What did you do to this app? trixiecheer , 08/23/2020 Messenger disappears My messenger icon disappeared a while ago and I wasn’t able to access it. I was able to do it through Facebook though. Then I found the icon on my iPhone through Siri app suggestions. Well now I can’t access it at all. Not through Facebook and not through Siri app suggestions, which is the only place that had the icon I could access. When I do click on it it shows for less than a second and disappears. It does it through Facebook, when I click on that messenger icon, and even when I try to get Siri to access it. When I go onto the App Store, it does the same thing. I want to uninstall it to hopefully restart it. I have rebooted my phone and left it off all night hoping that would help, but it didn’t. The icon that shows in Siri app suggestions will not allow me to hold it down so I can delete it like any other app. I think it’s because it’s not the app itself, just showing the icon that allowed me to access thru it, but that was it.I don’t know if this is making any sense or if I’m even explaining it correctly. I would literally have to show somebody what’s going on. All I could say is I cannot access messenger in any way shape or form not even to delete it or anything and I don’t know what to do . Ratings and Reviews See All 3.7 out of 5 61 Ratings 61 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. tr0mbonedude , 10/10/2020 Needs a few more features to be This is a great start and I particularly like how it’s directly integrated into Firefox. I like that this app comes from one of the most trusted companies in terms of privacy. With all this said, I don’t yet think it stands out from other password managers like LastPass or 1Password. For example, LastPass structures it like somewhat like this: Password entry: - Entry Name - Website Address - Password - Additional Notes Additionally, they have a versatile password generator and you can add and remove entries from any LastPass application. So LastPass makes it very quick and easy to manage passwords. If these features can be implemented, I’m switching over! Also, one cool thing that might draw more users into the Mozilla realm is a password Authenticator for two-factor authentication. I mean, history proves that you have been the authority of privacy and security. It’s worth a shot, I think. And if you can offer solutions like a versatile password manager, authenticator, and whatever other super awesome things you all offer, you will raise even more awareness to services like Mozilla VPN, and take back a considerable amount of market share from browsers that could care less about privacy. I’d love to see that. Keep up the great work! Information Seller Mozilla Corporation Size 58.7 MB Category Productivity Compatibility Requires iOS 11.0 or later. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. For example, LastPass structures it like somewhat like this: Password entry: - Entry Name - Website Address - Password - Additional Notes Additionally, they have a versatile password generator and you can add and remove entries from any LastPass application. So LastPass makes it very quick and easy to manage passwords. If these features can be implemented, I’m switching over! Ratings and Reviews See All 3.7 out of 5 65 Ratings 65 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. tr0mbonedude , 10/10/2020 Needs a few more features to be This is a great start and I particularly like how it’s directly integrated into Firefox. I like that this app comes from one of the most trusted companies in terms of privacy. With all this said, I don’t yet think it stands out from other password managers like LastPass or 1Password. For example, LastPass structures it like somewhat like this: Password entry: - Entry Name - Website Address - Password - Additional Notes Additionally, they have a versatile password generator and you can add and remove entries from any LastPass application. So LastPass makes it very quick and easy to manage passwords. If these features can be implemented, I’m switching over! Also, one cool thing that might draw more users into the Mozilla realm is a password Authenticator for two-factor authentication. I mean, history proves that you have been the authority of privacy and security. It’s worth a shot, I think. And if you can offer solutions like a versatile password manager, authenticator, and whatever other super awesome things you all offer, you will raise even more awareness to services like Mozilla VPN, and take back a considerable amount of market share from browsers that could care less about privacy. I’d love to see that. Keep up the great work! Information Seller Mozilla Corporation Size 58.7 MB Category Productivity Compatibility Requires iOS 11.0 or later. This version includes some bug fixes. Ratings and Reviews See All 3.7 out of 5 66 Ratings 66 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. tr0mbonedude , 10/10/2020 Needs a few more features to be This is a great start and I particularly like how it’s directly integrated into Firefox. I like that this app comes from one of the most trusted companies in terms of privacy. With all this said, I don’t yet think it stands out from other password managers like LastPass or 1Password. For example, LastPass structures it like somewhat like this: Password entry: - Entry Name - Website Address - Password - Additional Notes Additionally, they have a versatile password generator and you can add and remove entries from any LastPass application. So LastPass makes it very quick and easy to manage passwords. If these features can be implemented, I’m switching over! Also, one cool thing that might draw more users into the Mozilla realm is a password Authenticator for two-factor authentication. I mean, history proves that you have been the authority of privacy and security. It’s worth a shot, I think. And if you can offer solutions like a versatile password manager, authenticator, and whatever other super awesome things you all offer, you will raise even more awareness to services like Mozilla VPN, and take back a considerable amount of market share from browsers that could care less about privacy. I’d love to see that. Keep up the great work! Information Seller Mozilla Corporation Size 58.7 MB Category Productivity Compatibility Requires iOS 11.0 or later. Ratings and Reviews See All 3.6 out of 5 66 Ratings 66 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. tr0mbonedude , 10/10/2020 Needs a few more features to be This is a great start and I particularly like how it’s directly integrated into Firefox. I like that this app comes from one of the most trusted companies in terms of privacy. With all this said, I don’t yet think it stands out from other password managers like LastPass or 1Password. For example, LastPass structures it like somewhat like this: Password entry: - Entry Name - Website Address - Password - Additional Notes Additionally, they have a versatile password generator and you can add and remove entries from any LastPass application. So LastPass makes it very quick and easy to manage passwords. If these features can be implemented, I’m switching over! Also, one cool thing that might draw more users into the Mozilla realm is a password Authenticator for two-factor authentication. I mean, history proves that you have been the authority of privacy and security. It’s worth a shot, I think. And if you can offer solutions like a versatile password manager, authenticator, and whatever other super awesome things you all offer, you will raise even more awareness to services like Mozilla VPN, and take back a considerable amount of market share from browsers that could care less about privacy. I’d love to see that. Keep up the great work! Information Seller Mozilla Corporation Size 58.7 MB Category Productivity Compatibility Requires iOS 11.0 or later. Firefox Lockwise 4+ Safe password access anywhere Mozilla 3.6 • 68 Ratings Free Screenshots iPhone iPad Description PASSWORD ACCESS FOR YOU & ONLY YOU Securely track your Firefox passwords and access them anywhere Quickly open any website from the app to get into your accounts TRUSTED SECURITY FOR YOUR PERSONAL CREDENTIALS Use Face ID or Touch ID to lock the app and keep your passwords private Secure your information with an automatic timer which locks the app Tap to copy your username and password to get into apps and websites Set the browser you want to open your website URLs Created by Mozilla, voted the Most Trusted Internet Company for Privacy What’s New Version History Apr 9, 2020 Version 1.7.3 Thank you for updating to the latest version of Firefox Lockwise! This version includes some bug fixes. Ratings and Reviews See All 3.6 out of 5 68 Ratings 68 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. tr0mbonedude , 10/10/2020 Needs a few more features to be This is a great start and I particularly like how it’s directly integrated into Firefox. I like that this app comes from one of the most trusted companies in terms of privacy. With all this said, I don’t yet think it stands out from other password managers like LastPass or 1Password. For example, LastPass structures it like somewhat like this: Password entry: - Entry Name - Website Address - Password - Additional Notes Additionally, they have a versatile password generator and you can add and remove entries from any LastPass application. So LastPass makes it very quick and easy to manage passwords. If these features can be implemented, I’m switching over! Also, one cool thing that might draw more users into the Mozilla realm is a password Authenticator for two-factor authentication. I mean, history proves that you have been the authority of privacy and security. It’s worth a shot, I think. And if you can offer solutions like a versatile password manager, authenticator, and whatever other super awesome things you all offer, you will raise even more awareness to services like Mozilla VPN, and take back a considerable amount of market share from browsers that could care less about privacy. I’d love to see that. Keep up the great work! App Privacy See Details The developer, Mozilla, has not provided details about its privacy practices and handling of data to Apple. Then I found the icon on my iPhone through Siri app suggestions. Well now I can’t access it at all. Not through Facebook and not through Siri app suggestions, which is the only place that had the icon I could access. When I do click on it it shows for less than a second and disappears. It does it through Facebook, when I click on that messenger icon, and even when I try to get Siri to access it. When I go onto the App Store, it does the same thing. I want to uninstall it to hopefully restart it. I have rebooted my phone and left it off all night hoping that would help, but it didn’t. The icon that shows in Siri app suggestions will not allow me to hold it down so I can delete it like any other app. I think it’s because it’s not the app itself, just showing the icon that allowed me to access thru it, but that was it.I don’t know if this is making any sense or if I’m even explaining it correctly. I would literally have to show somebody what’s going on. All I could say is I cannot access messenger in any way shape or form not even to delete it or anything and I don’t know what to do . what do you mean name taken , 07/21/2020 Glitchy to the point of unusable. For the longest time, Facebook messenger with my go to for communication. I didn’t have everyone’s phone number and not many of my contacts used something like WhatsApp, but everyone has a Facebook account. This app is so glitchy that it’s finally broken me of Facebook period. I never really used the service as a social media platform to begin with, but it was a decent communication service. Or would have been. For the majority of this year, the software has been unreliable, glitchy, and riddled with bugs. It consistently fails to give notifications, occasionally forgets that I had sent a message, and by far the worst glitch: it will randomly kick me out of conversations while I’m reading them or typing in them and put me back at the contacts screen. And of course, it doesn’t save what I had been typing. This means that something as simple as sending a message can require you to start typing it two or five times before you can actually send one. There is no excuse for a company that big to deliver software this crappy, especially given how much shady crap they are otherwise up to involving user data. Check please, I am done. Ratings and Reviews See All 3.6 out of 5 70 Ratings 70 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. tr0mbonedude , 10/10/2020 Needs a few more features to be This is a great start and I particularly like how it’s directly integrated into Firefox. I like that this app comes from one of the most trusted companies in terms of privacy. With all this said, I don’t yet think it stands out from other password managers like LastPass or 1Password. For example, LastPass structures it like somewhat like this: Password entry: - Entry Name - Website Address - Password - Additional Notes Additionally, they have a versatile password generator and you can add and remove entries from any LastPass application. So LastPass makes it very quick and easy to manage passwords. If these features can be implemented, I’m switching over! Also, one cool thing that might draw more users into the Mozilla realm is a password Authenticator for two-factor authentication. I mean, history proves that you have been the authority of privacy and security. It’s worth a shot, I think. And if you can offer solutions like a versatile password manager, authenticator, and whatever other super awesome things you all offer, you will raise even more awareness to services like Mozilla VPN, and take back a considerable amount of market share from browsers that could care less about privacy. I’d love to see that. Keep up the great work! App Privacy See Details The developer, Mozilla, has not provided details about its privacy practices and handling of data to Apple. For the longest time, Facebook messenger with my go to for communication. I didn’t have everyone’s phone number and not many of my contacts used something like WhatsApp, but everyone has a Facebook account. This app is so glitchy that it’s finally broken me of Facebook period. I never really used the service as a social media platform to begin with, but it was a decent communication service. Or would have been. For the majority of this year, the software has been unreliable, glitchy, and riddled with bugs. It consistently fails to give notifications, occasionally forgets that I had sent a message, and by far the worst glitch: it will randomly kick me out of conversations while I’m reading them or typing in them and put me back at the contacts screen. And of course, it doesn’t save what I had been typing. This means that something as simple as sending a message can require you to start typing it two or five times before you can actually send one. There is no excuse for a company that big to deliver software this crappy, especially given how much shady crap they are otherwise up to involving user data. Check please, I am done. This version includes some bug fixes. Ratings and Reviews See All 3.7 out of 5 73 Ratings 73 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. tr0mbonedude , 10/10/2020 Needs a few more features to be This is a great start and I particularly like how it’s directly integrated into Firefox. I like that this app comes from one of the most trusted companies in terms of privacy. With all this said, I don’t yet think it stands out from other password managers like LastPass or 1Password. For example, LastPass structures it like somewhat like this: Password entry: - Entry Name - Website Address - Password - Additional Notes Additionally, they have a versatile password generator and you can add and remove entries from any LastPass application. So LastPass makes it very quick and easy to manage passwords. If these features can be implemented, I’m switching over! Also, one cool thing that might draw more users into the Mozilla realm is a password Authenticator for two-factor authentication. I mean, history proves that you have been the authority of privacy and security. It’s worth a shot, I think. And if you can offer solutions like a versatile password manager, authenticator, and whatever other super awesome things you all offer, you will raise even more awareness to services like Mozilla VPN, and take back a considerable amount of market share from browsers that could care less about privacy. I’d love to see that. Keep up the great work! App Privacy See Details The developer, Mozilla, has not provided details about its privacy practices and handling of data to Apple. Ratings and Reviews See All 4.2 out of 5 1.2M Ratings 1.2M Ratings Silverramette , 01/15/2018 Pointless Facebooks messenger app is a pointless application—everyone already has free text messaging and pays for cell phone service, so why create a new application (for things like virtual yard sale) and ask for permissions to text and call? I find it absolutely absurd that I have to download an app to view messages from a web based platform. (No I DO NOT have the FB app, thank you.). Not only that but the two rarely communicate efficiently. After you check messages in the app, FB profile will still show a messages notification. On top of that every time you use it asks for notifications to be turned on (why? When FB should be notifying you?) and asking for permission for microphone and camera. The app drains battery power when you do have notifications turned on especially in group chats—pinging every time there is a new comment. I’m not sure what a good use for this app is—it should be reintegrated back into Facebook and allow users to check messages from the web based platform. Firefox Lockwise 4+ Safe password access anywhere Mozilla 3.7 • 73 Ratings Free Screenshots iPhone iPad Description PASSWORD ACCESS FOR YOU & ONLY YOU Securely track your Firefox passwords and access them anywhere Quickly open any website from the app to get into your accounts TRUSTED SECURITY FOR YOUR PERSONAL CREDENTIALS Use Face ID or Touch ID to lock the app and keep your passwords private Secure your information with an automatic timer which locks the app Tap to copy your username and password to get into apps and websites Set the browser you want to open your website URLs Created by Mozilla, voted the Most Trusted Internet Company for Privacy What’s New Version History 9 Apr 2020 Version 1.7.3 Thank you for updating to the latest version of Firefox Lockwise! This version includes some bug fixes. Ratings and Reviews See All 3.7 out of 5 73 Ratings 73 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. tr0mbonedude , 10/10/2020 Needs a few more features to be This is a great start and I particularly like how it’s directly integrated into Firefox. I like that this app comes from one of the most trusted companies in terms of privacy. With all this said, I don’t yet think it stands out from other password managers like LastPass or 1Password. For example, LastPass structures it like somewhat like this: Password entry: - Entry Name - Website Address - Password - Additional Notes Additionally, they have a versatile password generator and you can add and remove entries from any LastPass application. So LastPass makes it very quick and easy to manage passwords. If these features can be implemented, I’m switching over! Also, one cool thing that might draw more users into the Mozilla realm is a password Authenticator for two-factor authentication. I mean, history proves that you have been the authority of privacy and security. It’s worth a shot, I think. And if you can offer solutions like a versatile password manager, authenticator, and whatever other super awesome things you all offer, you will raise even more awareness to services like Mozilla VPN, and take back a considerable amount of market share from browsers that could care less about privacy. I’d love to see that. Keep up the great work! App Privacy See Details The developer, Mozilla, has not provided details about its privacy practices and handling of data to Apple. Ratings and Reviews See All 4.2 out of 5 1.2M Ratings 1.2M Ratings Silverramette , 01/15/2018 Pointless Facebooks messenger app is a pointless application—everyone already has free text messaging and pays for cell phone service, so why create a new application (for things like virtual yard sale) and ask for permissions to text and call? I find it absolutely absurd that I have to download an app to view messages from a web based platform. (No I DO NOT have the FB app, thank you.). Not only that but the two rarely communicate efficiently. After you check messages in the app, FB profile will still show a messages notification. On top of that every time you use it asks for notifications to be turned on (why? When FB should be notifying you?) and asking for permission for microphone and camera. The app drains battery power when you do have notifications turned on especially in group chats—pinging every time there is a new comment. I’m not sure what a good use for this app is—it should be reintegrated back into Facebook and allow users to check messages from the web based platform. Lady Ash A. , 04/04/2020 New Update is Trash, Useless (iOS) The new update is absolutely disgusting. It makes this app not only visibly unappealing, but the new UI is hard to use, foolhardy, and removes many useful features. I also keep having problems with crashing. The new online/offline status is buggy and gets stuck. Phone calls are buggy too and stopped displaying properly. Messages can no longer be easily copied, deleted or forwarded. The old menu was easier. I preferred the swipe reply feature. Messages are no longer easy to reply to in notifications either. Pictures are not easy to send. I used to like this app because of the little unique things like the old cute reactions, chat colors, and balloons and hearts that you could catch. Now, they are all gone. I used to love using stickers, but the system is all messed up now as your most recent stickers and the packs are harder to find. I do not like the excess spacing between packs either. I am not exaggerating to say that I hate this new update. I have recommended that people do not update if they still have an older version. Many of my friends have agreed with me and say that this new version glitchy, problematic, and ugly. I have stopped using it as much because it is useless now. What did you do to this app? what do you mean name taken , 07/21/2020 Glitchy to the point of unusable. For the longest time, Facebook messenger with my go to for communication. I didn’t have everyone’s phone number and not many of my contacts used something like WhatsApp, but everyone has a Facebook account. This app is so glitchy that it’s finally broken me of Facebook period. I never really used the service as a social media platform to begin with, but it was a decent communication service. Or would have been. For the majority of this year, the software has been unreliable, glitchy, and riddled with bugs. It consistently fails to give notifications, occasionally forgets that I had sent a message, and by far the worst glitch: it will randomly kick me out of conversations while I’m reading them or typing in them and put me back at the contacts screen. And of course, it doesn’t save what I had been typing. This means that something as simple as sending a message can require you to start typing it two or five times before you can actually send one. There is no excuse for a company that big to deliver software this crappy, especially given how much shady crap they are otherwise up to involving user data. Check please, I am done. Ratings and Reviews See All 3.6 out of 5 74 Ratings 74 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! das rhetorician , 12/24/2020 NEW EDIT! Should also generate passwords just like it does for desktop I want to start off with this... I LOVE Mozilla as a company, entity of sorts; Firefox is an amazing web browser with great features and protections, Thunderbird is THE best desktop email application (I hope and pray maybe there could be an iOS/Android/Mobile version of Thunderbird); They make great products and services. I feel very let down by this mobile version of lockwise... it should generate passwords for the user also just like how it does in Firefox/Thunderbird... essentially, because it doesn’t generate passwords, this is a separate app you download for auto fill which Firefox for iOS already does and Chrome for iOS the same... Chrome for iOS also generates passwords... Slap that feature on there for us Mozilla!! And possibly allow us to protect lockwise with a form of 2FA like an authenticator or a security key! I have a Yubikey 5 NFC and I would love to be able to 2FA protect it like 1Password Byron LastPass owners can. Anyways... if you guys could add those features into this app it would be perfect, I am a diehard Mozilla fan but this app felt like it wasn’t really thought out... Also, the ability to EDIT password entries and to manually enter password credentials is essential and important to me and many other users! Please update this soon Mozilla! thank you all for all the effort you put into your products and services, I am a huge fan! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. I have a hard enough time explaining where features are to my grandmother, and this didn’t help at all. But my biggest complaint is that for the past month or two, I’ve had an “extra” notification appear on the app icon. Like I have a message, except I do not. l check my “spam” folder, message requests, even scroll through all my messages, and nothing. But it will still show “1” on the icon. I deleted it and downloaded it again and that helped, for a short amount of time before it happened again. This is my 3rd time deleting and reinstalling. It’s not just annoying. Lady Ash A. , 04/04/2020 New Update is Trash, Useless (iOS) The new update is absolutely disgusting. It makes this app not only visibly unappealing, but the new UI is hard to use, foolhardy, and removes many useful features. I also keep having problems with crashing. I am not exaggerating to say that I hate this new update. I have recommended that people do not update if they still have an older version. Silverramette , 01/15/2018 Pointless Facebooks messenger app is a pointless application—everyone already has free text messaging and pays for cell phone service, so why create a new application (for things like virtual yard sale) and ask for permissions to text and call? I find it absolutely absurd that I have to download an app to view messages from a web based platform. (No I DO NOT have the FB app, thank you.). Not only that but the two rarely communicate efficiently. After you check messages in the app, FB profile will still show a messages notification. On top of that every time you use it asks for notifications to be turned on (why? When FB should be notifying you?) and asking for permission for microphone and camera. The app drains battery power when you do have notifications turned on especially in group chats—pinging every time there is a new comment. I’m not sure what a good use for this app is—it should be reintegrated back into Facebook and allow users to check messages from the web based platform. Ratings and Reviews See All 3.7 out of 5 75 Ratings 75 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! das rhetorician , 12/24/2020 NEW EDIT! Should also generate passwords just like it does for desktop I want to start off with this... I LOVE Mozilla as a company, entity of sorts; Firefox is an amazing web browser with great features and protections, Thunderbird is THE best desktop email application (I hope and pray maybe there could be an iOS/Android/Mobile version of Thunderbird); They make great products and services. I feel very let down by this mobile version of lockwise... it should generate passwords for the user also just like how it does in Firefox/Thunderbird... essentially, because it doesn’t generate passwords, this is a separate app you download for auto fill which Firefox for iOS already does and Chrome for iOS the same... Chrome for iOS also generates passwords... Slap that feature on there for us Mozilla!! And possibly allow us to protect lockwise with a form of 2FA like an authenticator or a security key! I have a Yubikey 5 NFC and I would love to be able to 2FA protect it like 1Password Byron LastPass owners can. Anyways... if you guys could add those features into this app it would be perfect, I am a diehard Mozilla fan but this app felt like it wasn’t really thought out... Also, the ability to EDIT password entries and to manually enter password credentials is essential and important to me and many other users! Please update this soon Mozilla! thank you all for all the effort you put into your products and services, I am a huge fan! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. Ratings and Reviews See All 4.2 out of 5 1.2M Ratings 1.2M Ratings Silverramette , 01/15/2018 Pointless Facebooks messenger app is a pointless application—everyone already has free text messaging and pays for cell phone service, so why create a new application (for things like virtual yard sale) and ask for permissions to text and call? I find it absolutely absurd that I have to download an app to view messages from a web based platform. (No I DO NOT have the FB app, thank you.). Not only that but the two rarely communicate efficiently. After you check messages in the app, FB profile will still show a messages notification. On top of that every time you use it asks for notifications to be turned on (why? When FB should be notifying you?) and asking for permission for microphone and camera. The app drains battery power when you do have notifications turned on especially in group chats—pinging every time there is a new comment. I’m not sure what a good use for this app is—it should be reintegrated back into Facebook and allow users to check messages from the web based platform. Lady Ash A. , 04/04/2020 New Update is Trash, Useless (iOS) The new update is absolutely disgusting. It makes this app not only visibly unappealing, but the new UI is hard to use, foolhardy, and removes many useful features. I also keep having problems with crashing. The new online/offline status is buggy and gets stuck. Phone calls are buggy too and stopped displaying properly. Messages can no longer be easily copied, deleted or forwarded. The old menu was easier. I preferred the swipe reply feature. Messages are no longer easy to reply to in notifications either. Pictures are not easy to send. I used to like this app because of the little unique things like the old cute reactions, chat colors, and balloons and hearts that you could catch. Now, they are all gone. I used to love using stickers, but the system is all messed up now as your most recent stickers and the packs are harder to find. I do not like the excess spacing between packs either. I am not exaggerating to say that I hate this new update. I have recommended that people do not update if they still have an older version. Many of my friends have agreed with me and say that this new version glitchy, problematic, and ugly. I have stopped using it as much because it is useless now. What did you do to this app? what do you mean name taken , 07/21/2020 Glitchy to the point of unusable. For the longest time, Facebook messenger with my go to for communication. I didn’t have everyone’s phone number and not many of my contacts used something like WhatsApp, but everyone has a Facebook account. This app is so glitchy that it’s finally broken me of Facebook period. I never really used the service as a social media platform to begin with, but it was a decent communication service. Or would have been. For the majority of this year, the software has been unreliable, glitchy, and riddled with bugs. It consistently fails to give notifications, occasionally forgets that I had sent a message, and by far the worst glitch: it will randomly kick me out of conversations while I’m reading them or typing in them and put me back at the contacts screen. And of course, it doesn’t save what I had been typing. This means that something as simple as sending a message can require you to start typing it two or five times before you can actually send one. There is no excuse for a company that big to deliver software this crappy, especially given how much shady crap they are otherwise up to involving user data. Check please, I am done. Ratings and Reviews See All 3.6 out of 5 77 Ratings 77 Ratings Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! das rhetorician , 12/24/2020 NEW EDIT! Should also generate passwords just like it does for desktop I want to start off with this... I LOVE Mozilla as a company, entity of sorts; Firefox is an amazing web browser with great features and protections, Thunderbird is THE best desktop email application (I hope and pray maybe there could be an iOS/Android/Mobile version of Thunderbird); They make great products and services. I feel very let down by this mobile version of lockwise... it should generate passwords for the user also just like how it does in Firefox/Thunderbird... essentially, because it doesn’t generate passwords, this is a separate app you download for auto fill which Firefox for iOS already does and Chrome for iOS the same... Chrome for iOS also generates passwords... Slap that feature on there for us Mozilla!! And possibly allow us to protect lockwise with a form of 2FA like an authenticator or a security key! I have a Yubikey 5 NFC and I would love to be able to 2FA protect it like 1Password Byron LastPass owners can. Anyways... if you guys could add those features into this app it would be perfect, I am a diehard Mozilla fan but this app felt like it wasn’t really thought out... Also, the ability to EDIT password entries and to manually enter password credentials is essential and important to me and many other users! Please update this soon Mozilla! thank you all for all the effort you put into your products and services, I am a huge fan! gdsouza Gustavo , 05/02/2020 Not bad, but needs a lot more features The app is pretty nice, especially on the desktop, but the mobile app, is very very simple and lacks a lot of things, especially the ability to add new entries, and to set a "name" or "tag" to each entry, this would make it easier to find things, and make everything more organized. On the same organization subject, there could be a folder system, to group related passwords and logins, another one is, a custom/more complex entry, e.g with notes. From mozilla I really expected a bit more, every other service from mozilla is amazingly well done, aesthetically pleasing and very complete, this one was really a disappointment though, but it has a lot of room and a great platform already built for lots of improvement. Even if it had a subscription/paid service, it would be great to have all those features. What did you do to this app? what do you mean name taken , 07/21/2020 Glitchy to the point of unusable. For the longest time, Facebook messenger with my go to for communication. I didn’t have everyone’s phone number and not many of my contacts used something like WhatsApp, but everyone has a Facebook account. This app is so glitchy that it’s finally broken me of Facebook period. I never really used the service as a social media platform to begin with, but it was a decent communication service. Or would have been. For the majority of this year, the software has been unreliable, glitchy, and riddled with bugs. It consistently fails to give notifications, occasionally forgets that I had sent a message, and by far the worst glitch: it will randomly kick me out of conversations while I’m reading them or typing in them and put me back at the contacts screen. And of course, it doesn’t save what I had been typing. This means that something as simple as sending a message can require you to start typing it two or five times before you can actually send one. There is no excuse for a company that big to deliver software this crappy, especially given how much shady crap they are otherwise up to involving user data. Check please, I am done. Firefox Lockwis‪e‬ 4+ Safe password access anywhere Mozilla 3.7 • 79 Ratings Free Screenshots iPhone iPad Description PASSWORD ACCESS FOR YOU & ONLY YOU Securely track your Firefox passwords and access them anywhere Quickly open any website from the app to get into your accounts TRUSTED SECURITY FOR YOUR PERSONAL CREDENTIALS Use Face ID or Touch ID to lock the app and keep your passwords private Secure your information with an automatic timer which locks the app Tap to copy your username and password to get into apps and websites Set the browser you want to open your website URLs Created by Mozilla, voted the Most Trusted Internet Company for Privacy What’s New Version History Apr 9, 2020 Version 1.7.3 Thank you for updating to the latest version of Firefox Lockwise! This version includes some bug fixes. Ratings and Reviews See All 3.7 out of 5 79 Ratings 79 Ratings JANTTiLA , 01/30/2021 Good start to combining passwords between browsers Easily syncs between Mac/iOS/PC instances of Firefox. Integrates with iOS very well. Works with Chrome, Firefox, others as described in documentation online. Exporting from with Desktop Safari 12 and 13 is a real chore as Apple is constantly striving for better privacy/security within its own ecosystem. However, export from Desktop Safari can be accomplished.. You need a third-party script called “mrc-converter-suite”. to export from Safari. The resulting CSV export file from mrc-converter-suite will have to be re-formatted to Justin Scott’s (deprecated) Password Exporter plugin CSV format. Note the needed format including enclosing quotes for each website. I used Excel. Finally, import the re-formatted CSV file using Justin Scott’s FireFox Password Exporter plugin (will also import) using Firefox Developer Edition Version 53. Once logged into Lockwise, the Safari passwords will be imported and able to be used with Lockwise. It’d be much easier if there was a way to import directly from Safari desktop, but there doesn’t appear to be an automated or easy way to accomplish this using any other program. Because I was ultimately successful in accomplishing this (imported 300 passwords) and I couldn’t do it with any out-of-the-box with any commercial/trial software I tried). Therefore, I’ll give it 4 stars (out of 5) but it takes time, effort and patience. Thehiltyfamily , 09/30/2020 Two seriously needed features Great job on the core features of a password storage and management system. This app is in critical need of: 1) Editing options for stored passwords. Firefox lockwise on desktop is the only way to edit saved passwords at this time. When you change a password on mobile and then proceed to forget it when you’re back at your desk, you wish you had the ability to save it in lockwise on your phone. 2) Workarounds for choppy integration into iOS by design. Maybe a widget, some backend for the shortcuts feature, or some other way to get to lockwise fast. Apple tries to kill outside password managers on iOS by making keychain the only seamless password manager on iOS. Lockwise should work around those restrictions by beating Apple at its own game and giving users a way to get to them by, say, a back-tap gesture. Thanks, Locksise team! das rhetorician , 12/24/2020 NEW EDIT! Should also generate passwords just like it does for desktop I want to start off with this... I LOVE Mozilla as a company, entity of sorts; Firefox is an amazing web browser with great features and protections, Thunderbird is THE best desktop email application (I hope and pray maybe there could be an iOS/Android/Mobile version of Thunderbird); They make great products and services. I feel very let down by this mobile version of lockwise... it should generate passwords for the user also just like how it does in Firefox/Thunderbird... essentially, because it doesn’t generate passwords, this is a separate app you download for auto fill which Firefox for iOS already does and Chrome for iOS the same... Chrome for iOS also generates passwords... Slap that feature on there for us Mozilla!! And possibly allow us to protect lockwise with a form of 2FA like an authenticator or a security key! I have a Yubikey 5 NFC and I would love to be able to 2FA protect it like 1Password Byron LastPass owners can. Anyways... if you guys could add those features into this app it would be perfect, I am a diehard Mozilla fan but this app felt like it wasn’t really thought out... Also, the ability to EDIT password entries and to manually enter password credentials is essential and important to me and many other users! Please update this soon Mozilla! thank you all for all the effort you put into your products and services, I am a huge fan!
